result.execSummary:
The defendant Donald P. Gilligan was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Credit for 2 days only if revoked.
Concurrent with: 20CF145

miscConds.notes: The defendant must undergo an AODA assessment and follow through with all recommendations.

The defendant must undergo an anger management assessment and follow thru with all recommendations.

The defendant must take all medications as prescribed and in the manner in which they are prescribed.

The defendant must take any over-the-counter medications as described.

The defendant may not possess or consume alcohol or THC - even if THC is legal in the jurisdiction that the defendant may be in.

The defendant may not enter into any bars, taverns or liquor stores.

The defendant must maintain/obtain full time employment/school that consists of at least 35 hrs/week.

When not full time employed/school, the defendant must apply for at least 3 jobs per week and report progress monthly to P&P with pertinent information in regards to applications.  The defendant must only apply for jobs qualified for - must accept any job offered - must not engage in any conduct that could result in the termination of his/her employment/school.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Donald P. Gilligan

records.addlTxt: from DCC Records staff to Court regarding sentence structure

2:29 PM Prosecuting attorney Alexander Paul Seifert in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Donald P. Gilligan in court.  Attorney Rick Terrence Cveykus in court for Donald P. Gilligan. Court calls 20CF145 and 22CF63. State - resolved - has complied with victim notification requirement with no response. On 20CF145  amend count #1 to misd battery but keeping repeater and domestic abuse enhancers, defendant to plead G to amended count #1 and to count #2 as alleged; on 22CF63 - plead G to count #1 alleged. 20CF145 - #1 - withhold sentence and place on probation for 2 years with a $500.00 fine plus costs, 30 days conditional jail, #2 - 2 year probation, costs #1 on 22CF63 - #1 - withhold sentence and place on probation for 2 years - all concurrent to each other with costs and also AODA and follow thru, anger management and follow thru, maintain absolute sobriety, no entry into any bars, taverns or liquor store, no possession or possession of alcohol and THC - even if legal in the jurisdiction he may be in, maintain/obtain full time employment/school, take all meds as prescribed and in the manner in which they are prescribed, take all over-the-counter medication as described. Gilligan and Cveykus agree except that count #1 on 22CF63 was to be amended to misd BJ. State agrees and apologizes. Court - 22CF63 - count #1 - amend to misd BJ. Court - 20CF145 - amend count #1 to battery contrary to 940.19 - reads new charge and penalty - domestic abuse and repeater status follow and gives instructions on what that means. Gilligan pleads G to count #1 as amended on 22CF63 and G to count #1 as amended on 20CF145 and G to count #2 as alleged. Court has plea questionnaire, goes thru it, finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his constitutional rights by entering his plea and right to JT, accepts pleas, adjudges guilty, proceed to sentencing. State makes final argument prior to sentencing - follow joint recommendation. Cveykus makes final argument prior to sentencing - follow joint recommendation - asks until 8/1/22 to report for status reasons (ankle monitoring). Gilligan withholds comment. Court sentences the defendant to the following: 22CF63 - count #1 - withhold sentence and place on probation for 2 years with conditions of: AODA and follow thru, anger management and follow thru, maintain absolute sobriety, no entry into any bars, taverns or liquor store, no possession or possession of alcohol and THC - even if legal in the jurisdiction he may be in, maintain/obtain full time employment/school, take all meds as prescribed and in the manner in which they are prescribed, take all over-the-counter medication as described, costs - take bond posted, concurrent to 20CF145, credit for 2 days only if revoked; 20CF145 - both counts - withhold sentence and place on probation for 2 years - concurrent to each other and to 22CF63 - same conditions as 20CF145, count #1 - 30 days conditional jail - report by 5:00 PM on 7/22/22 - credit for 2 days only if revoked, $500.00 fine plus costs - take bond posted, count #2  same conditions with no additional jail or fine, costs - take bond posted, submit DNA sample, right to appeal, adjourned.
Plea/sentencing hearing on July 14, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Jury trial on June 10, 2022 at 08:30 am.

02:52 PM Defendant Donald P. Gilligan in court with attorney Rick Terrence Cveykus.  Alexander Paul Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin. State here for PH, believes it will be a waiver. Gilligan and Cveykus agree. Court goes over waiver with Gilligan, finds he is freely, voluntarily and intelligently waiving his right to PH, finds probable cause and binds over for trial. Information has been filed. Cveykus waives further reading, proceeds to ARGN and enters NG pleas to all counts. Court accepts pleas, continues bond - notices bond has not been signed - court instructs to go to COC to sign bond. Gilligan agrees. Court will have set for JT.

records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt: 09:31 AM Defendant Donald P. Gilligan in court with attorney Rick Cveykus appearing by video.  Alexander Paul Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Cveykus has went over complaint, waives further further reading, would like PH and waives time limits for PH, states there is another open case that he represents him on and possible resolution. Court has scheduled for PH and continues bond.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 28, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
No consumption of alcohol. Must submit to law enforcement request for test of breath or blood to determine if alcohol consumed.
